para: The Modify command applies a modification operator to a &skel;. The available operations are listed in the class.

A good &skel; must be (1) a faithful representation of its µ and (2) composed of well-shaped elements. An element's quality is measured by its homogeneity and its shape energy. Modifications to &skels; naturally aim at either better adaptation to material boundaries (homogeneity), or better element shape (shape energy), or both.

&oof2; provides various tools to help adapt a &skel; to its material boundaries. Unfortunately, these tools are not magic wands that you can swing to automatically create perfect &skels;. These tools work best with careful intervention and, therefore, users should learn the basics of each modification tool. Fortunately, once a sequence of operations has been found that works well on one µ, it's likely to work well on other related µs;. See the reference page for more information.
To apply a to only part of a &skel;, either use an &active; or the tools for pinning &nodes; in the menu.
